intro: Epischoenus complanatus, commonly known as the flat-leaved water plant, is a species of aquatic plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and slow-moving streams. The plant has elongated, ribbon-like leaves that lie flat on the water surface, aiding in photosynthesis. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in loose inflorescences. Epischoenus complanatus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small invertebrates and contributing to water quality through oxygen production.
